issues.subject: teuthology-kill: ability to zap the entire queue
issues.description:
when the queue gets backed up by several days it is awkward to clear out the queue.

bonus points for:
- filtering by user
- filtering by machine type

"description: rados/singleton/{all/rest-api.yaml fs/btrfs.yaml msgr-failures/many.yaml}
email: null
job_id: '38758'

  kdb: true
  sha1: f2be82b0058e90b5d9ac2cb896b4914276fb50ef

machine_type: plana
name: teuthology-2014-01-14_19:00:22-rados-dumpling-testing-basic-plana
nuke-on-error: true
os_type: ubuntu
overrides:
  admin_socket:
    branch: dumpling
  ceph:
    conf:
      global:
        ms inject socket failures: 500
      mon:
        debug mon: 20
        debug ms: 1
        debug paxos: 20
      osd:
        debug ms: 1
        debug osd: 5
        osd op thread timeout: 60
    fs: btrfs

    - slow request

  ceph-deploy:
    branch:
      dev: dumpling
    conf:
      client:
        log file: /var/log/ceph/ceph-$name.$pid.log
      mon:
        debug mon: 1
        debug ms: 20
        debug paxos: 20
        osd default pool size: 2
  install:
    ceph:
      sha1: ee9fc590a556354b54a174a4790c4142949d7409
  s3tests:
    branch: dumpling
  workunit:
    sha1: ee9fc590a556354b54a174a4790c4142949d7409

  - mon.1
  - mon.2
  - mds.a
  - osd.0
  - osd.1
  - osd.2
  - client.0
tasks:
- chef: null
- clock.check: null
- install: null
- ceph:
    log-whitelist:
    - wrongly marked me down
    - had wrong client addr
- rest-api:
  - client.0
- workunit:
    clients:
      all:
      - rest/test.py
teuthology_branch: dumpling
verbose: true

issues.subject: unable to find SHA1 from ceph.com git mirror
issues.description:
Tests are failing because some hash does not exist in the git mirror Log excerpt: 
2014-01-14T21:36:51.490 INFO:teuthology.orchestra.run.err:[10.214.138.60]: error: Failed connect to ceph.com:80; No such file or directory (curl_result = 7, http_code = 0, sha1 = c20860ae0a8c52f5ff4b55eb9581729f4e5dcfe9)
2014-01-14T21:36:51.490 INFO:teuthology.orchestra.run.err:[10.214.138.60]: error: Unable to find 0ae72e3adb392beb926336b22386af7b81104d45 under http://ceph.com/git/ceph-qa-chef.git
2014-01-14T21:36:51.490 INFO:teuthology.orchestra.run.err:[10.214.138.60]: Cannot obtain needed blob 0ae72e3adb392beb926336b22386af7b81104d45
2014-01-14T21:36:51.491 INFO:teuthology.orchestra.run.err:[10.214.138.60]: while processing commit b7120725a9c10e6f42d198700c2e80fe16c74db0.

issues.subject: Teuthology performance testing tracker
pulpito: display timezone
issues.description: It would help if http://pulpito.ceph.com/ displayed the timezone to figure out when a run actually happened even when looking at it from france. I guess it's PDT but it would not hurt to not have to guess.

issues.subject: redhat-lsb package cannot be installed
issues.description:
Apparently, chef-solo times out waiting to connect. Not entirely sure if this is entirely a problem on our end (we've seen this exact same one before). But creating a ticket regardless so we can track it even it if appears to be invalid. Log output explaining the problem:

issues.description:
Seen on this run: sage-2013-12-30_20:59:21-krbd-next-for-stable-3.10.24-basic-plana 
Traceback (most recent call last):

    load_entry_point('teuthology==0.0.1', 'console_scripts', 'teuthology-coverage')()

issues.subject: pulpito: Some jobs that have passed are still listed as running by Pulpito.
issues.description: http://pulpito.ceph.com/sage-2013-12-22_12:21:25-rados:thrash-wip-cache-testing-basic-plana/ has 3 jobs that are listed as still running: 11952, 11958, and 11983.  If you look at the teuthology.log files for these jobs, all 3 appear to have passed.

issues.subject: Rethink which runs to show on pulpito's front page
pulpito reporting -- it would be nice to see reports of dead/failed/running jobs
issues.description:
Pulpito is great as far as showing the status of a run in general, but when one sees that a suite has 20 failed, 30 dead, and 10 still running jobs, one still needs to look at a bunch of files to figure out whats going on with these runs.

It would be cool if there were somewhere we can get a report like:
24 -- killed while still waiting for machines
5 -- Host not found error
1 -- <Unique message for this one run>
.
.
.

I started to write a python script to following links and parse the html, but I think that it makes more sense to have a task at the database level to generate
this report,

issues.subject: Long hostnames break schedule_suite.sh
issues.description:
A hostname of longer than 14 characters won't work with schedule_suite.sh possibly due to locking owner length limit.

2013-12-17T09:21:13.345 INFO:teuthology.run:Summary data:
{description: 'rados/thrash/{clusters/fixed-2.yaml fs/btrfs.yaml msgr-failures/few.yaml
    thrashers/default.yaml workloads/radosbench.yaml}', failure_reason: 'machine ubuntu@plana25.front.sepia.ceph.com
    is locked by scheduled_dzafman@macbookpro-ubu, not scheduled_dzafman@macbookpro-ubuntu-build',
  owner: scheduled_dzafman@macbookpro-ubuntu-build, sentry_event: 'http://sentry.ceph.com/inktank/teuthology/search?q=93b191b95a184da7b9e6816b9ed94a3c',
  success: false}

The owner is chopped in the output of teuthology-lock --list

  "locked_by": "scheduled_dzafman@macbookpro-ubu",

issues.subject: pulpito: show pass/fail stats by machine
Docstrings for orchestra functions and classes are needed.
issues.description: Docstrings are missing from orchestra py files.

issues.subject: Docstrings should be added to misc functions
issues.description: Docstrings are missing from teuthology/misc.py

issues.subject: Local functions in misc should be distinguished.
issues.description: get_test_user, gen_addresses, and remove_lines_from_file should be _get_test_user, _gen_addresses and _remove_lines_from_files

issues.subject: Teuthology README doesn't adequately provide a quick start
issues.description:
Reading the README for teuthology, I had the impression that the lock server was something that was only used when --lock was given; but trying to run it gives an error connecting to the lock server. I had to look elsewhere to learn about check-locks.

The example should probably include check-locks: false, and the section on locking should reflect that it is the default.

issues.subject: Teuthology: The program vs. tasks.
issues.description: These should probably be decouple more.

issues.subject: Decouple teuthology and Inktank's infrastructure
issues.description: Some planning required before we actually do this.

issues.subject: Some overnight teuthology runs generate a whole bunch of output.
issues.description:
I doubt that this is expected behavior, because I am pretty sure no human being is wading through all this information This may also account for some of the jobs that hang overnight and clog the machines. The following is from teuthology-2013-12-06_02:10:30-upgrade-rgw-next-testing-basic-plana/132981

issues.subject: Downburst documentation is bad.
issues.description: README.rst says that a downburst option is disk.  That should probably read disk-size.

issues.subject: teuthology-lock downburst yaml file use is broken
issues.description: One should be able to indicate a downburst file to use for vps machines in the .teuthology.yaml file.  The lock.py code appears to be broken here.  Also, this should be documented in at least the README.rst file.
